description:
The monthly energy rate for service under the economic development rate schedule shall be $0.0452 per kilowatt hour (kWh).

The monthly demand rate for service under the economic development rate schedule shall be $11.60 per kilowatt (kW). The monthly billing kilowatt demand for any month shall be the maximum one hour integrated kilowatt demand recorded during that month.

The total monthly electric charges (energy charges plus demand charges) shall be capped and not exceed $0.10 per kilowatt hour (kWh) for all electricity sold to such economic development customers being served under said economic development rate from the effective date of this section until July 31, 2014. All electricity sold on or after August 1, 2014, shall be charged at full demand and energy rates without regard to any such cap.
energycomments: Purchase power adjustment for economic development rate = average per-kilowatt-hour cost of purchased power in the preceding three months (TOTAL COST / TOTAL SOLD) - $0.0685

name: Economic Development Rate
